ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Fits singular linear models to longitudinal data. Singular linear models are useful when the number, or timing, of longitudinal observations may be informative about the observations themselves. They are described in Farewell (2010) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asp068>, and are extensions of the linear increments model <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2007.00590.x> to general longitudinal data.

Fits singular linear models to longitudinal data. Singular linear models are useful when the number, or timing, of longitudinal observations may be informative about the observations themselves. They are described in Farewell (2010) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asp068>, and are extensions of the linear increments model <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2007.00590.x> to general longitudinal data.

name: r-slim
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-slim
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/slim_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/slim/slim_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 416d39294d7d24ab95d73cf46af79ca72cca43432ff157902e81576ab8992b75

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1006
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass >=7.3
    - r-data.table >=1.9.6
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass >=7.3
    - r-data.table >=1.9.6

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('slim')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('slim')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=slim
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Fits singular linear models to longitudinal data. Singular linear models are useful
    when the number, or timing, of longitudinal observations may be informative about
    the observations themselves. They are described in Farewell (2010) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asp068>,
    and are extensions of the linear increments model <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2007.00590.x>
    to general longitudinal data.   '
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
